revision.text:
{{Infobox military structure |name=Victoria Barracks |image=Victoria Road, Beverley - geograph.org.uk - 629381.jpg |caption =The building on the right, now converted into flats, is all that remains of the old barracks |type = Barracks |map_type = East Riding of Yorkshire |pushpin_map_caption = Location within East Riding of Yorkshire |location = [[Beverley]] |latitude = 53.82313 |longitude = -0.44297 |coordinates = {{Coord|53.82313|N|0.44297|W|region:GB_type:landmark|display=inline,title}} |ownership = [[Ministry of Defence (United Kingdom)|Ministry of Defence]] |operator = {{army|United Kingdom}} |built = 1877â€“1878 |used=1878-1960 |architect = |built_for = [[War Office]] |garrison = |occupants = [[East Yorkshire Regiment]] }} '''Victoria Barracks''' was a military installation in [[Beverley]], [[East Riding of Yorkshire]], England.
==History== The barracks were built as the [[Regimental depot|depot]] of the two battalions of the [[East Yorkshire Regiment|15th (The Yorkshire East Riding) Regiment of Foot]] between 1877 and 1878.<ref name=bh>{{cite web|title=Public Institutions, A History of the County of York East Riding: Volume 6: The borough and liberties of Beverley|year=1989|page=190-195|url=http://www.british-history.ac.uk/report.aspx?compid=36442 |accessdate= 11 November 2014}}</ref> Their creation took place as part of the [[Cardwell Reforms]] which encouraged the localisation of British military forces.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/uknews/defence/9383385/Echoes-of-the-past-in-these-Army-cuts.html|title=Echoes of the past in these Army cuts|date=8 July 2012| accessdate= 13 November 2014}}</ref> Following the [[Childers Reforms]], the 15th Regiment of Foot evolved to become the [[East Yorkshire Regiment]] with its depot at the barracks in 1881.<ref name=training>{{cite web|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060210172841/http://www.regiments.org/regiments/uk/depot/1873.htm|title=Training Depots|publisher=Regiments.org|accessdate=16 October 2016}}</ref>
Many recruits enlisted at the barracks at the start of the [[World War I|First World War]]<ref>{{cite web|url= http://ghostblooms-van-asten.blogspot.co.uk/2009/11/in-memoriam-abel-layton-1891-1915.html|title=Abel Layton 1891-1915 |publisher=Ghost Blooms|accessdate= 11 November 2014}}</ref> and the barracks were significantly extended during the [[World War II|Second World War]].<ref name=bh/> The Regiment amalgamated with the [[West Yorkshire Regiment]] to form the [[Prince of Wales's Own Regiment of Yorkshire]] in 1958. Following demolition of the barracks, the [[Ministry of Defence (United Kingdom)|Ministry of Defence]] disposed of the site in 1977 and it is now largely occupied by a [[Morrisons]] supermarket.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.driffieldtoday.co.uk/sitemap-article-2014-32.xml|title=1950 East Yorkshire Parade Ground Beverley|work=Driffield Today| accessdate= 11 November 2014}}</ref>
